intro: Pedicularis pseudoatra, commonly known as the dark pedicularis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy flowers. The plant produces tubular, reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
